data.title: Just OK
data.text: We went for a late lunch but there was still a long line and the restaurant was crowded. Despite ordering a couple of slices (which were available in their front warmer) and some breadsticks, our order took more than 20 mins. The food was ok but the restaurant a cool vibe.

data.title: best pizza in town
data.text: Yes best pizza and they ran out of pizza dough so had to closed for business b4 the Sunday Hawks play and they WON... so next time call b4 going also there 2nd location was closed too :-(

data.title: Good Pizza, Great Cannoli!
data.text: Big New York style pizza slices in a historic location. Outside seating during the summer. Salads and top off you meal with a cannoli!

data.title: Pretty Darned Good Pizza
data.text: If you're downtown Everett, this is a fast, fun, easy, & relaxing place to go have pizza. No pretensions here. Not A+ pizza, but on the other hand, it's a lot better than other places I've had pizza. You also aren't overcharged for your food........fair price for a great product. The atmosphere here is very laid back and it is a popular place with the locals. If I was exploring downtown Everett and I wanted a pizza, or if I was across the street from the Comcast Arena for an event and wanted pizza.......I'd do Brooklyn Brothers.

data.title: Amazing pizza
data.text: This is real New York style pizza! Really good taste. Service was quick! Our favorite was the Hudson.

data.title: Typical Decent Pizza Joint
data.text: If you need pizza by the slice or a whole pie to share among friends, Brooklyn Brothers has you covered. Beer and wine are also available here.

data.title: Pizza pizza
data.text: Mixed reviews from the family. We did not care for the Athenian -- way too many kalamata olives and not enough of any other topping. Olives were overpowering! Guys ordered the Sicilian. It was big! But too much bread. Quantity good. Maybe we should have bought by the slice instead!

data.title: friend from Long Island says this is the best place in area for NY pizza
data.text: a wide variety of pizzas, NY style (thin - crust) other than the "Sicilian".  Unassuming décor (with NYC overtones), but the pizza is the draw.

data.title: Great pizza and beer
data.text: We have done pick up as well as eat in multiple times. Good food, quick service. Decent beer selection on tap. One of the best pizzas I've found in everett.

data.title: Pretty darn good!
data.text: One of my life's missions  has been to find a West coast pizza reminiscent of my East coast experience. The pizza there came from an Italian immigrant family, generations serving pizza since early 1900s. So I looked for a specific type of dough, balanced sauce, herb-flavors and mozzarella and olive oil drizzles. I ate LOTS of pizza and enjoyed most if it while bemoaning "not quite right." I'm happy to say Brooklyn Brothers is the closest I have found to my memory's standard. I strongly recommend that you, too, try the pizza.  The place isn't anything special - tables and chairs in an old, funky building - it's all about the pizza.

data.title: One of the best pizzas around!
data.text: This place is one of my favorite pizza places!   Last couple of times we have ordered takeout, there have been phone issues, we were hung up on and sometimes no one would answer the phone.   Also the sausage was different this time.   I like the original sausage much better

data.title: Yes
data.text: More Better Great authentic NYC taste. Not like the junk that passes for PIE in mostWest Coast eateries.

data.title: Heaven
data.text: Best pizza ever by the slice or take home an entire piev either way you will be eating a little bite of heaven.

data.title: Disappointed with the pizza
data.text: We ordered a whole pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, and red onions.  The sauce was bland and watery.  It had soaked through the crust before it even got to the table, making the pizza very soggy.  The pepperoni was also bland.  The onions were raw, bitter and unpleasant.  We were hoping for much better based on the tripadvisor rating.

data.title: Works for me - love the pizza by the slice, just a good experience
data.text: I know, it's just pizza but this is a friendly, efficient place and I love being able to get pizza by the slice.  Not much more one can write.  Good place.  I'll be back.

data.title: Didn't find the pizza as good as most of the reviews
data.text: I went here just because of the reviews. The atmosphere in the old building was great but the pizza was just average to me. I'm sure it depends on what you are used to but I wouldn't return.

data.title: Best pizza
data.text: The best pizza I've ever had.  We ordered the Hudson, so good.  I also ordered a salad, limp lettuce and not worth the price.  Stick with the pie!

data.title: Great pizza . . . but beer in plastic cups?
data.text: We enjoyed the New York-style thin-crust pizza they make at Brooklyn Brothers.  You can order by the slice (a generous piece) or get a whole pizza.  If you don't like their creations, build your own.  Place your order at the counter, get your drinks and a number to identify your table--your food will be delivered to you.  We waited maybe 20 minutes on a busy Friday evening.  Now to my gripe:  if they can serve wine in real glasses (nothing fancy, just a large tumbler), why can't they serve beer in glass mugs?  Better yet, chilled glass mugs?  The plastic cup is flimsy, doesn't keep the beer cold, and . . . it's plastic.  Yuck.

data.title: Never Disappointed 🍕🍕👍🏼
data.text:
It's been a while since I've eaten at Brooklyn Brothers Pizzeria and I tell ya, I'm never disappointed. Delicious as always 😊

The service is also great❗️

data.title: Dinner
data.text: If you want authentic New York pizza...just go. The best pizza in town. Everett WA is a culinary dead zone. The owners are from Brooklyn and it's good. My suggestion order the "Bowery". They have several types of beer, salads and authentic canolli. You might have a wait, but it's worth it. Bowery ppl, Bowery.
